snippet: Two weeks before Bahrain is scheduled to hold a prestigious international motor race, the kingdom's attempts to project an image of calm were shattered on Friday when the police fired tear gas at thousands of protesters in the capital, Manama.
abstract: Two weeks before Bahrain is scheduled to hold a prestigious international motor race, the kingdom's attempts to project an image of calm were shattered on Friday when the police fired tear gas at thousands of protesters in the capital, Manama.

headline.main: Bahrain Activist's Hunger Strike Belies Image of Calm Ahead of Formula One Race
